Key Arguments: The submission argues that Australian government officials should be disqualified from parliament if they are members of the World Economic Forum (WEF), citing the Australian Constitution's disqualification clause.
It claims that the World Health Organisation (WHO) acts as a de-facto foreign power when Australian governmental bodies act upon its information.
The submission suggests that the proposed legislation is an attempt by the government to conceal its failures in governance and constitutional responsibilities.
Main Themes: Criticism of government transparency and accountability
Notable Quotes: I take this to mean, WEF members are ineligible to be in parliament and should be disqualified.
The only reason the government is trying to implement this legislation is to hide failings in the governance of the following constitutional responsibilities.
